1957

December 
Eleventh 
1 918

Mr. S. $. Ewan 
536 Commonyaalth Ave.

Boston, Mass.

My dear Iwan:

The enclosed letter tells its own story; and I am sorry 
that it is not a more cheerful one. I talked with Mr. Ropes, Mr. 
Lowell's brother-in-law, at our recent Trustee meeting; and he told 
me that there wore only two men left in Mr. Lowell's office at the

present time, and that one of these had assured him only within a

for days that there was absolutely nothing for him to do but close

up. Building operations, except in the matter of Government con -
destruction, have simply gone to the dis card during the war. Ever -
one expects an early revival; and possibly we may find it with us by 
the time Ir. Lowell returns from abroad. I hope so certainly, and 
in the meantime shall be glad to keep my eyes and ears open for pus -
bible opportunities else there.

Ever yours,
